title.narrative: Centre For Human, Pastoral and Spiritual Formation - Peace Building and Trauma Healing

description.narrative:
South Sudan has suffered years of civil wars and the recent eruption of conflicts that has degenerated into tribal fights continue to put the young nation in a precarious situation. The church sees itself as the only stabilizing factor over the past decades through peaceful engagement and dialogue with the leaders, a role that they would continue to especially at this of the year where nation is greatly polarized into tribal factions likely to prolong the fighting. The church considers a sound spiritual, human and pastoral formation a top priority and thus proposes: A Center for human, pastoral and spiritual formation; peace building and trauma healing.
At the moment, there's not existing facility throughout South Sudan that caters for larger of group for retreat or seminar/workshop participants, providing conference rooms and overnight accommodation and lodging. Several dioceses have PALICA - Pastoral Liturgical Catechetals) centers that can offer conference rooms for day sessions and only are suited for in-house diocesan participants. Up to now, seminars/workshops on the national level involving a good number of participants from out of towns and other dioceses have made use of low costs hotels particularly in Juba while on numerous occasions, the number of participants to these gatherings have had to be limited due to inadequate space.
